availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James G. Clark (Crittenden Co, KY, + Eddyville (Lyon cl.) physician)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, physician. Virginia native. Married to Mary W. Cobb Clark in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on September 10, 1829. Father of Modena Clark, Henry Clark, and Giles Clark. Physician in Caldwell County in 1850. Physician in Eddyville in 1860. Physician in Crittenden County in 1860. Household owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 393B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, West Half, p. 331.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, West Half, p. 359A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 767.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 25.
